class.name: Dictionary
class.description: Dictionary type. Associative container which contains values referenced by unique keys. Dictionaries are always passed by reference. Erasing elements while iterating over them [b]is not supported[/b]. Creating a dictionary: [codeblock] var d = {4: 5, "A key": "A value", 28: [1, 2, 3]} [/codeblock] To add a key to an existing dictionary, access it like an existing key and assign to it: [codeblock] d[4] = "hello" # Add integer 4 as a key and assign the String "hello" as its value. d["Godot"] = 3.01 # Add String "Godot" as a key and assign the value 3.01 to it. [/codeblock]

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the dictionary, removing all key/value pairs.

method.name: duplicate
method.description: Creates a copy of the dictionary, and returns it.

method.name: empty
method.description: Return true if the dictionary is empty.

method.name: erase
method.description: Erase a dictionary key/value pair by key. Do not erase elements while iterating over the dictionary.

method.name: get
method.description: Returns the current value for the specified key in the [Dictionary]. If the key does not exist, the method returns the value of the optional default argument, or Null if it is omitted.

method.name: has
method.description: Return true if the dictionary has a given key.

method.name: has_all
method.description: Return true if the dictionary has all of the keys in the given array.

method.name: hash
method.description: Return a hashed integer value representing the dictionary contents.

method.name: keys
method.description: Return the list of keys in the [Dictionary].

method.name: size
method.description: Return the size of the dictionary (in pairs).

method.name: values
method.description: Return the list of values in the [Dictionary].
